titleStmt.title: John Quincy Adams Diary Digital Project

div.p: 25. V:30.W. D. Lewis here, with his papers— At the Office Hemphill with Latimer to be Consul at St. Thomas’s. Canning—about the Colonial Intercourse—long discussion— Slave-Trade; the same joint representation to France—my particular opinions. Letter from E. B. Jackson— Maine Resolutions— Miralla, Dr and Mrs Thornton, Laborie, C. Pinkney here this Eve. Miralla’s improvisation— Note from James Barbour S.U.S. to draw Slave Convention Bill.

26. VII. Heard Frey, the converted Jew at the Capitol. Matthew 11.2.3.4.5. Visit to Sergeant and Barstow. M’Sherry there— Card to R. G. Amory—also to Judge Bay and M. Carey. Then to judge Rowan and Son— Saw James Barbour Chairman Comee. S.U.S.— Slave Convention Appropriation. British Colonial Intercourse— Told him result of the Cabinet Meeting; and conversation yesterday with Canning. Saw Clay at James Brown’s. Chevallié there. Heard Little P.M. 1. Timothy 6.13.14.15.16— Cushman. Frye here after dinner— Eve at Dr Thornton’s— Small party. Johnson Hellen and Charles unwell— Writing to E. B. Jackson.

27. VI:30.Romulus M. Saunders here to solicit a Consular appointment for a friend— At the Office, Steele, appointed District Attorney for West-Florida came to take leave— Goes to-morrow. W. D. Lewis, with his papers. Latimer, an applicant for appointment of Consul at St. Thomas’s, with a Recommendation. Dr Sewall, for a Book to send to Dr Daniel Coney of Augusta, Maine— Compared in part original Roll of the Constitution with pamphlet Copy, printed by Direction of the Department. R. G. Amory, Barstow and his son,Robert Buchanan. W. D. Lewis, C. Pinkney, and J Sergeant dined with us— Johnson Hellen and Charles unwell, not at table. Petry, Evening here.

28. VII.Johnson Hellen to Rockville. Cabinet Meeting. Wirt only absent. Instructions to D. Porter, to pursue Pirates on the land in Cuba— My objections— No Constitutional right in the Executive to give them— P.U.S. reserves the decision. Crawford earnest for them. Case of the Apollon— Rodney at P.U.S. how to go to Buenos-Ayres? Calhoun afterwards at the Office, for W. G. D. Worthington. Parish with Notes from Canning— Colonial Intercourse— Letters from Charles Stuart Waugh, Fredericksburg to Josiah Butler, from R. M. Livingston Schuylerville Saratoga, and E. Sage Sag-harbour to J. W. Taylor, and from S. A. Wells to James Lloyd sent to me, to be returned. Weekly Evening party— H. Clay and Matthew Carey here—about 150. Dancing with Piano Music. Sent Letter to E. B. Jackson.

29. VI:45.M. L. Hill here. At the Office. Jennings of Indiana, for money for Huffman. Poinsett from Mexico; with despatches from J. S. Wilcocks there, J. M. Forbes at Buenos-Ayres and J. B. Prevost, Chili— Rodney, about going to Buenos-Ayres— A Frigate—and for a Consulate for T. Reilly at Aguatulco— Dr Kent with Captain Blake from Indiana. W. Fox of Falmouth England, with Letters recommending T. W. Fox jr for Consul at Plymouth. Draft of Report to Senate on Memorial of B. J. Shain— Dined with George and Charles at Mrs Decatur’s. Bishop Dubourg, of Louisiana— Eve at Canning’s Ball. Chess with Stevenson.

30. VII. Young Bulfinch here with Letter from his father, about his Salary. L. Rice for Columbian College Loan— At the Office. O’Brien, about his petition to Congress— At P.U.S— To notify the new appointed Ministers. Canning’s proposals, Slave-trade— Colonial Intercourse— Company to dine— Allen of Tennessee, P. P. Barbour, Barstow, Condict, D’Wolf, ElliottHerrick, Kirkland, R. R. Reid, W. Smith of S.C. Vance, Van Dyke & Wright— Letter from James Roberts at Annapolis to Wright— Evening at Thompson’s Secy Navy— Bresson wedding party. Ball— Chess with Stevenson.

31. VII. At the Office— W. D. Lewis with a Letter from Jos. R. Ingersoll. Calls from Both Houses of Congress. Reports to be made numerous. Evening, second wedding party at S. Thompson’s— Secy of the Navy. Mrs Adams and the children went. I did not go— In my room writing— Have a bad cold and cough. Flight of Snow this morning— Cold—
